argument.name: expression
argument.description: An expression that incorporates fields of the tables of the set.

page.description: Returns TRUE if expression is valid in the context of the table.
page.discussion: The .EVAL_VALID()evaluates Expression and returns .T. (TRUE), if Expression is valid (can be interpreted as Xbasic code), or .F. (FALSE) if the Expression is invalid. This function is useful when the expression to be evaluated is itself constructed by another expression. The <SET>.EVAL() method will return the value of the expression.
page.example: dim s as P s = set.open("invoice") ? s.eval_valid("invoice_header->data") = .F. ' the fieldname is spelled wrong ? s.eval_valid("invoice_header->date") =.T. ? s.eval("invoice_header->date") = {01/10/2016}
